events.description: Snap vote called by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi scheduled for the upcoming weekend.
Quarterly economic growth report due for release next week.
Renesas Electronics announced plans to sell its Timing business to SiTime for $3 billion.

facts.fact_text: The Nikkei 225 Index fell 0.7% to below 54,000 on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: The Nikkei 225 Index fell 0.7% to below 54,000 on Thursday
the broader Topix Index lost 0.1% to 3,650

facts.fact_text: Renesas Electronics shares rose 7% following the announcement of a $3 billion business sale to SiTime.

evidences.evidence_text: Renesas Electronics jumped 7% after announcing plans to sell its Timing business to SiTime for $3 billion.

facts.fact_text: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi called for a snap vote.

evidences.evidence_text: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi called the snap vote

claims.claim_text: Investors are selling Japanese shares because they are focusing on the upcoming weekend elections.

evidences.evidence_text: extending losses from the previous session as investors turned their attention to lower house elections scheduled for this weekend.

claims.claim_text: Japan's Q4 GDP is expected to rebound after a previous contraction.

evidences.evidence_text: expected to rebound after a sharp contraction in the prior quarter.

claims.claim_text: The Prime Minister is seeking voter support for increased government spending.
claims.author: Sanae Takaichi

evidences.evidence_text: she seeks voter backing for increased spending and other policy priorities.

evidence.evidence_text: extending losses from the previous session as investors turned their attention to lower house elections
Japan’s Q4 GDP report due next week, which is expected to rebound
Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi called the snap vote as she seeks voter backing for increased spending
Renesas Electronics jumped 7% after announcing plans to sell its Timing business
